Questions.QuestionString: How is the wing ice protection valve operate?
Answers: The valve is spring loaded closed, electrically controlled and pneumatically actuated.
The valve is spring loaded closed, electrically controlled and actuated.
The valve is spring loaded open, electrically controlled and pneumatically actuated.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the feature of the Wing Ice Protection System (WIPS)?
Answers: To protect the wing leading edge, slats three, four and five against ice on each wing .
To protect the wing leading edge and all slats against ice on each wing.
To protect the wing leading edge and three outboard slats against ice on each wing.

Questions.QuestionString: On the  ground the WIPS valves :
Answers: Are inhibited to avoid the slat overheat.
Can be opened for a limit time during the test.
Can be operated without any restriction.

Questions.QuestionString: Engine NAI systems has two valves, PRSOV and a PRV, in normal operation:
Answers: The PRV also acts as a backup pressure regulator when the PRSOV has failed.
The PRSOV and PRV operates independently depending on engine power setting.
The PRSOV also acts as a backup pressure regulator when the PRV has failed.

Questions.QuestionString: The windows anti icing/defogging system can be operated:
Answers: In automatic mode only.
In manual mode only.
In two modes: automatic or manual

Questions.QuestionString: The WHC regulates the temperature of the cockpit windows based on the measured temperature value. When one temperature sensor is defective:
Answers: Manually switch to the other sensor on OMT
The related WHC automatically uses data from one of the other sensors.
Manually switch to the other sensor on the window

Questions.QuestionString: What is the feature of the Wing Ice Protection System (WIPS)?
Answers: To protect the wing leading edge, slats three, four and five against ice on each wing .
To protect the wing leading edge and all slats against ice on each wing.
To protect the wing leading edge and three outboard slats against ice on each wing.

Questions.QuestionString: How does the Wing Ice Protection System (WIPS) operate?
Answers: WIPS has only a manual mode which is activated using the ANTI ICE WING P/B SW.
WIPS has an automatic mode which is activated during the icing condition.
WIPS has an automatic and manual mode.

Questions.QuestionString: On the  ground the WIPS valves :
Answers: Are inhibited to avoid the slat overheat.
Can be opened for a limit time during the test.
Can be operated without any restriction.

Questions.QuestionString: Which statement below is true?
Answers: The wing ice protection valve is On/Off valve and controlled by WIPS application and BOMUs.
The wing ice protection valve is modulating valve and controlled by WIPS application and BOMUs.
The wing ice protection valve is shut-off and modulating valve and controlled by WIPS application and BOMUs.

Questions.QuestionString: How is the wing ice protection valve operate?
Answers: The valve is spring loaded closed, electrically controlled and pneumatically actuated.
The valve is spring loaded closed, electrically controlled and actuated.
The valve is spring loaded open, electrically controlled and pneumatically actuated.

Questions.QuestionString: The Bleed Air Monitoring(BAM) application controls the wing anti-ice valve by:
Answers: Torque motor( TM)
Solenoid( SOL)
Electrical motor

Questions.QuestionString: Function of the wing ice protection monitor temperature sensor is:
Answers: To detect the overheat condition in the flight.
To regulate the wing ice protection valve.
To detect the overheat condition on the ground.

Questions.QuestionString: The engine Nacelle Anti-Icing (NAI) protection system prevents ice build-up by using hot bleed air from:
Answers: The engine compressor (HP3) bleed port
Downstream of MPV
The engine compressor (IP8) bleed port

Questions.QuestionString: Engine NAI systems has two valves, PRSOV and a PRV, in normal operation:
Answers: The PRV also acts as a backup pressure regulator when the PRSOV has failed.
The PRSOV and PRV operates independently depending on engine power setting.
The PRSOV also acts as a backup pressure regulator when the PRV has failed.

Questions.QuestionString: The windows anti icing/defogging system can be operated:
Answers: In automatic mode only.
In manual mode only.
In two modes: automatic or manual

Questions.QuestionString: The WHC regulates the temperature of the cockpit windows based on the measured temperature value. When one temperature sensor is defective:
Answers: Manually switch to the other sensor on OMT
The related WHC automatically uses data from one of the other sensors.
Manually switch to the other sensor on the window

Questions.QuestionString: Which is the Overheat condition of the cockpit windows:
Answers: The temperature of one of the cockpit windows is more than 60 deg.C
The temperature of one of the cockpit windows is more than 42 deg.C
The temperature of one of the cockpit windows is more than 35 deg.C

Questions.QuestionString: The ground test for WIPS valve opening time  is limited to(A, B1, B2)
Answers: 20 seconds
25 seconds
30 seconds

Questions.QuestionString: After testing the period time WIPS is inhibited for system distribution cooling down is:(A, B1, B2)
Answers: 10 minutes
15 minutes
20 minutes

Questions.QuestionString: The WIPS application controls the wing anti-ice valve via:(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Torque motor(TM)
Solenoid(SOL)
Shut-off motor

Questions.QuestionString: The Bleed Air Monitoring(BAM) application controls the wing anti-ice valve by:(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Torque motor(TM)
Solenoid(SOL)
Shut-off motor

Questions.QuestionString: Function of the wing ice protection monitor temperature sensor(A, B1, B2)
Answers: It is used on ground only for overheat detection
It is used in flight only for overheat detection
Its signal is used to control the Torque motor

Questions.QuestionString: Closure of the wing ice protection valve is:(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Indirectly controlled by the BOMU and directly by the WIPS application through the CRDCs
Directly controlled by the BOMU and indirectly by the WIPS application through the CRDCs
Directly controlled by the BOMU and the WIPS application through the CRDCs

Questions.QuestionString: The engine Nacelle Anti-Icing (NAI) protection system prevents ice build-up by using hot bleed air from:(A, B1, B2)
Answers: The engine compressor (IP8) bleed port
The engine compressor (HP3) bleed port
Downstream of MPV

Questions.QuestionString: Engine NAI systems has two valves, PRSOV and a PRV, in normal operation:(A, B1, B2)
Answers: The PRSOV also acts as a backup pressure regulator when the PRV has failed.
The PRV also acts as a backup pressure regulator when the PRSOV has failed.
The PRSOV and PRV act independent depend on engine power setting.

Questions.QuestionString: Engine Anti-Ice System inoperative the maintenance action required is:(B1, B2)
Answers: PRSOV is secured in closed position
PRV is secured in closed position
Both valves are secured in closed position

Questions.QuestionString: The windows anti icing/defogging system can be operated in:(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Two modes: automatic or manual
Only automatic mode
Manual mode can only be activated when automatic mode failed

Questions.QuestionString: The WHC regulates the temperature of the cockpit windows based on the temperature value it receives from one of the three temperature sensors. When one the temperature sensor defective.(A, B1, B2)
Answers: The related WHC automatically uses data from one of the other sensors.
Manually switch to the other sensor on OMT
Manually switch to the other sensor on the window

Questions.QuestionString: Which is the Overheat condition of the cockpit windows:(A, B1, B2)
Answers: The temperature of one of the cockpit windows is more than 35 deg.C
The temperature of one of the cockpit windows is more than 42 deg.C
The temperature of one of the cockpit windows is more than 60 deg.C
